image.altText: Man holds rock lobster

props.synopsis: While the Liberal-turned-independent SA state MP has been facing and denying the charges for seven years, he has now been found guilty — but his fate as a parliamentarian remains unclear.

title.children: A state MP has been found guilty of theft and dishonesty — will he stay in parliament?

image.altText: A woman smiles in front of the Sydney Harbor Bridge.

props.synopsis: South Australian murder victim Victoria Stewart was a guide, bright light and loving safe place for her five children before her horrific death almost 12 months ago, the Supreme Court has heard.

title.children: Murder victim's loved ones confront killer in SA court

image.altText: A hand holds a mobile phone with the screen showing several social media apps

props.synopsis: As governments — and social media giants — announce measures aimed to safeguard children from social media, teenagers continue to access popular apps such as TikTok, Instagram, Snapchat and Youtube. So what can caregivers do to help children navigate social media safely?

title.children: As governments consider social media bans for children, what can parents do in the meantime?

image.altText: an aerial shot of a long, straight and dusty road with pastoral land on either side of it on a clear day

props.synopsis: Licensing approvals have been granted for a uranium exploration project in a remote area of South Australia. The project, spanning a total 3,000 square kilometres, is expected to start in October.

title.children: Search for uranium in massive area of outback SA gets the green light

image.altText: About 600 campervans and motorhomes in a showground from the air with a rainbow

props.synopsis: RV owners are trying their best to quell a reputation as a stingy group of travellers during a large gathering in South Australia this week with efforts to spend locally, donate items, and learn about Indigenous culture.

title.children: Campervan and motorhome owners highlight their economic muscle as hundreds gather for rally

image.altText: A woman wearing a United Workers Union Hat

props.synopsis: With three SA tomato businesses, including a major supplier, forced into quarantine because of the outbreak of a crop virus, workers like Sharon Tarisesei have lost their jobs, and are apprehensive about securing future employment.

title.children: Tomato virus outbreak leaves migrant farm workers facing battle to 'make ends meet'

image.altText: Aerial shot of a group of houses, all of which have solar panels on their roof

props.synopsis: For decades, a big risk to Australia's electricity system has been excessive demand in summer. Now, it is excessive supply in spring.

title.children: Market operator issues first-ever low-demand warning as solar 'juggernaut' risks grid overload

image.altText: NZF_0046 destroyed house Russia invasion odyssey

props.synopsis: After Ukraine launched a surprise assault on Russian territory in August, the ABC's Europe correspondent Kathryn Diss and camera operator Fletcher were invited by the military to visit an occupied town in Russia.

title.children: ABC crew becomes subject of Russian criminal investigation for crossing border from Ukraine

image.altText: Jim Chalmers and NDRC Chairman Zheng Shanjie sit at a wide desk in a formal meeting room.

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers meets with his Chinese counterpart to discuss the country's flagging economy and how that may impact Australia, as well as some lingering trade bans and the test-firing of an intercontinental ballistic missile.

title.children: He's the first Australian treasurer to visit Beijing in 7 years. So what did Chalmers's trip achieve?

image.altText: A man standing in a crowd and waves

props.synopsis: Japan's next prime minister will be maverick regional politician Shigeru Ishiba, after the ruling Liberal Democratic Party elected him its new leader following the news Prime Minister Fumio Kishida would step down.

title.children: Japan's former defence chief who tried and failed to be prime minister many times finally wins the top job

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers talks National Accounts

props.synopsis: After days of speculation over who ordered public servants to take another look at the tax breaks, the treasurer has spoken up.

title.children: Jim Chalmers concedes he asked Treasury for negative gearing modelling

image.altText: Women in blue suits holding red folders throw white documents in the air

props.synopsis: Tasmania's Supreme Court quashes a tribunal decision that would have forced a museum to allow men to enter its women-only "Ladies' Lounge".

title.children: 'Women are better than men': Mona curator celebrates after Supreme Court win for ladies lounge

image.altText: optus 'yes' sign on glass fronted office block

props.synopsis: Optus failed to provide honest and credible communication during last year's phone outage, and should be forced to provide fair compensation in the event of another, a Senate committee has found.

title.children: Optus failed to honestly communicate in 'potentially dangerous' mass mobile and internet outage

image.altText: A man with long blonde air wearing a navy singlet sitting on a chair

props.synopsis: As the inquest into Josh Warneke's death comes to an end, Ingrid Bishop says she is unable to grieve for her beloved son due to a lack of answers.

title.children: 'Tragic and violent secret': Mother pleads for answers about what happened to son found dead 14 years ago

image.altText: Melania Trump wearing a black dress and dark sunglasses. Donald Trump's silhouette is visible in the reflection of her glasses

props.synopsis: Former first lady Melania Trump sits down for a rare interview in which she reviews Donald Trump's political record and recounts the moment she learned her husband had been shot in an assassination attempt.

title.children: Some strong tweets, but everything else is great': The takeaways from Melania Trump's sit-down interview with Fox

image.altText: A young couple sitting at a table and smiling.

props.synopsis: Indigenous rights pioneer Joyce Clague persevered through early life on a mission and a childhood of racism and discrimination to become an international activist.

title.children: Tributes flow for First Nations activist with 'fire in the belly'

image.altText: Jahrome Hughes of the Melbourne Storm sticks his tongue out as he runs with the football in an NRL game against the Roosters.

props.synopsis: The Melbourne Storm are the first team through to the NRL grand final after a thumping 48-18 win over the Sydney Roosters. Follow live.

title.children: Jahrome Hughes shreds Roosters to send Melbourne Storm into another NRL grand final

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: The Melbourne Storm are your first NRL grand finalists!
Cameron Munster goes in and the Storm will return to the grand final!
Ryan Papenhuyzen goes in again and the Storm have some breathing room

image.altText: An elderly Japanese man wearing a green vest and hat sits on a chair looking directly at the camera with a pensive expression

props.synopsis: Human rights groups call for the end of the death penalty in Japan after Iwao Hakamada, who spent 45 years in solitary confinement on death row, is found to have been wrongfully convicted of murder.

title.children: Japanese man's acquittal after 48 years on death row puts nation's death penalty policy under spotlight

image.altText: Fiji’s President Ratu Wiliame Katonivere speaking at the United Nations

props.synopsis: China has insisted the test was "not directed at any country or target" but it has still generated considerable unease in the Pacific.

title.children: China's launch of an intercontinental ballistic missile criticised by Fiji, Australia, Palau and New Zealand

image.altText: A moving satellite image of a hurricane moving over the coast of Florida.

props.synopsis: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis says one death has been attribute to Helene so far, but that number will likely rise as the state wakes up on Friday morning.

title.children: Hurricane Helene weakens to tropical storm after making landfall in Florida

image.altText: Woman grocery shopping in dairy aisle

props.synopsis: A new report from the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission has found many Australians have lost trust in supermarkets as it investigates the mega grocers' market power and potential barriers to entry in the sector.

title.children: ACCC supermarket inquiry investigating Coles and Woolworths' market power and barriers to entry

props.synopsis: High in the Chilean desert, the Extremely Large Telescope is taking shape. It promises sharper views of space than we've ever seen — but will Australian astronomers be able to use it?

title.children: 'We will not fail': The Extremely Large Telescope in Chile is astronomy's next big thing — if it works

image.altText: A pink funeral booklet that has CHARLOTTE O'BRIEN in the title

props.synopsis: Charlotte O'Brien was 12 years old when she took her own life earlier this month. Her parents want her story to be shared.

title.children: Parents honour 'beautiful and kind' daughter who took her own life after alleged bullying

image.altText: Cigdem Aslan smiles, standing in a suburban garden beside red and pink flowers.

props.synopsis: The daughter of an Australian woman arrested in Türkiye is calling on the federal government to help bring her mother home, saying the accusations against her are "categorically false".

title.children: Daughter pleads for release of Australian woman arrested in Türkiye over alleged terrorism links

image.altText: Historic moments from the 2004 and 2005 grand finals

props.synopsis: Saturday's clash between Brisbane and Sydney will be just the fourth time in AFL history where two teams based outside of Victoria have battled for the premiership cup. If the previous three are anything to go by, fans are in for one hell of a show.

title.children: Sabotage claims, heavyweight brawls and an iconic mark — fireworks guaranteed when non-Victorian teams meet in AFL grand finals

image.altText: A soldier covers his ears as a tank explodes

props.synopsis: Israel has been giving strong signals it plans to launch a ground invasion of Lebanon as part of its war against Hezbollah, but whether it has learnt from its last military campaign in the country remains to be seen.

title.children: What Israel can learn from its 2006 ground invasion of Lebanon, which 'failed completely'

image.altText: The word Cranbrook in gold on a sandstone column at the gates of a school.

props.synopsis: The independent review into the prestigious Sydney school was announced after the ABC's Four Corners exposed allegations of a toxic culture and revealed the former headmaster kept a teacher on despite knowing he sent graphic emails to a former female student.

title.children: Cranbrook School apologises for 'past failings' after a review that included child safety issues

image.altText: A woman and man in their 60s smile for a selfie in front of a sign that says 'Welcome to Texas'.

props.synopsis: As an accessible insight into trans lives, and possibly the first trans film some will encounter when browsing Netflix, Will & Harper succeeds in its emotional honesty.

title.children: Will Ferrell's new Netflix doco takes on transphobia in the US, but it's really about friendship

image.altText: A graphic showing a microscopic photo of the mpox virus and a red arrow

props.synopsis: Between July and September 26, the number of mpox cases increased by more than 570 per cent to a total of 724. One way to address to growing number of cases is increasing vaccination rates.

title.children: Mpox spread accelerates in Australia with 85pc of this year's cases recorded since July

image.altText: Niecy Nash-Betts as a detective looking up in the air, a frightened/surprised expression on her face, shining a torch

props.synopsis: NFL tight end Travis Kelce is being praised for his acting debut in Grotesquerie, a series about a detective who accepts the help of a nun and journalist as she investigates a series of unsettling crimes.

title.children: Niecy Nash-Betts stars as detective investigating unsettling crimes in series also featuring Travis Kelce

image.altText: Adam Driver in Francis Ford Coppola's Megalopolis

props.synopsis: For better or worse, Frances Ford Coppola's long-awaited passion project featuring a laundry list of high-profile actors has finally hit cinemas.

title.children: Megalopolis took more than 40 years and $120m to make. It's been worth every bit of trouble

image.altText: A graphic shows a food delivery app surrounded by a ghost-like haze.

props.synopsis: Have you noticed new dining options popping up on food delivery apps, but can't find their local shopfront? Chances are the food comes from a dark kitchen, also known as ghost or cloud kitchens.

title.children: Multiple restaurants from one location: your food might be being made in a ghost kitchen

image.altText: LOST PARADISE

props.synopsis: The US ticket-selling platform Lyte has shut down, leaving two Australian music festivals in the lurch.

title.children: 'We are taking this situation seriously': Aussie festivals respond after US ticketing agent shuts down

image.altText: A composite image

props.synopsis: Righto then, smarty pants, test yourself.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Surprise Aria nods, Pesto the penguin, and a new Socceroos coach
